metadata.description: Assign the environment for Azure (Azure Commercial or Gov)
The name of the Administrator of all VMs and Domain
Name of key vault used to store encrypted values for deployment. This key vault is created during predeployment steps.
Name of the resource group that holds the key vault above
Choose to skip SQL Always On configuration
Azure location that VMs will be deployed to
Cert 64bit encoded .pfx file for SSL. See generateCert.ps1 in ./predeploy folder
Cert 64bit encoded .pfx file for SSL
The GUID for the runbook job to be started for Azure Automation
Assign a name for the Log Analytic Workspace Name
Assign a name for the Automation Account name

metadata.desscription: Name of the RecoveryServices Vault to store VM backups

metadata.description: Azure Backup policy to apply to VMs
Times in day when backup should be triggered. e.g. 01:00, 13:00. This will be used in LTR too for daily, weekly, monthly and yearly backup.
Number of days you want to retain the backup
Backup will run on array of Days like, Monday, Tuesday etc. Applies in Weekly retention only.
Number of weeks you want to retain the backup
Number of months you want to retain the backup
Array of Months for Yearly Retention
Number of years you want to retain the backup
Specify the region for your Workspace
Service Tier for OMS: Free, Standalone, or PerNode
Number of days of retention. Free plans can only have 7 days, Standalone and OMS plans include 30 days for free
Patching schedule name
Prefix for environement (production or staging). You can change the allowed values based on your preference.
Select kek if the secret should be encrypted with a key encryption key and pass explicit keyEncryptionKeyURL. For nokek, you can keep keyEncryptionKeyURL empty.

resources.name: VirtualNetworkNSG
resources.comments: This resource will create storage accounts for Active Directory, SQL Server, File Share Witness and Diagnostics. It will also create the Virtual Network and public IP addresses
